title: Faróis
body:
It was only in the mid-third quarter of the last century that the lighting of the coasts of our archipelago was truly considered. Several attempts had been made previously, but without appreciable results.

On June 25, 1861, the Madeira deputies Antonio Gonçalves de Freitas, Luiz de Freitas Branco, and D. Luiz da Câmara Leme presented a bill in parliament authorizing the construction of a rotating lighthouse at Ponta de S. Lourenço and a fixed lighthouse on Ilhéu da Pontinha. This new attempt also proved to be fruitless.

Ilhéu da Pontinha: Location where an attempt was made to build a fixed lighthouse.

1861: Presentation of the bill for the construction of lighthouses in Madeira.
